The presentation was monotonous, which caused me to disengage from it. The learning material was pretty basic, and most probably below my current level of understanding - I didn't learn any thing new.

results.content: Good for beginners

The course explained most basic concepts with simple examples, but most of the time you will need to do your own research to get a better understanding. Also, some examples used certain concepts that are not explained before and assumes that we know about it (which most of us don't). The course is very elementary, but not enough to become experienced in CSS and Javascript.
results.content_html: The course explained most basic concepts with simple examples, but most of the time you will need to do your own research to get a better understanding. Also, some examples used certain concepts that are not explained before and assumes that we know about it (which most of us don't). The course is very elementary, but not enough to become experienced in CSS and Javascript.

Si nunca tocaste ningun lenguaje, el curso te viene bien. El problema es la integracion de todo, es muy poca en este curso. Tenes 2 partes, una de CSS y otra de JS por separado, mientras que otros te ofrecen básicamente lo mismo de una manera mucho mas integrada y escalable para el que busca aprender, no se si vale la pena gastar el tiempo para aprender ambas por separado si después necesitas integrarlas. Por el tiempo que se puede llegar a invertir acá, creo que existen mejores opciones

results.content:
The instructor's language is quite clear. Concepts are well explained, but the course should have focused on many detailed topics rather than just the basics. 
The course is outdated for 2020 as there are many changes in JS.
The titles in the content section for many lectures are not correct or I should say are mismatched. The last two lectures of projects aren't available.
I feel that the instructor could have used an editing code such as Atom, VS Code, etc. rather than notepad.
results.content_html:
The instructor's language is quite clear. Concepts are well explained, but the course should have focused on many detailed topics rather than just the basics.
The course is outdated for 2020 as there are many changes in JS.
The titles in the content section for many lectures are not correct or I should say are mismatched. The last two lectures of projects aren't available.
I feel that the instructor could have used an editing code such as Atom, VS Code, etc. rather than notepad.
